result.execSummary:
The defendant Lorane Mantell Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Release to the Day Reporting Center only.  Court notes an objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge during course of probation to the probation agent.  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Obtain/maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176 the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and voting.
No possession of any firearms, weapons, or any drug paraphernalia.

Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.   Successfully  complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.
Must attend at least one alcohol and drug assessment treatment or sobriety support group per week.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lorane Mantell Lee in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Danielle Chojnacki for   Sentencing proceeded.  
Statements by the State and Defense. 
Defendant sentenced to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with release to the Day Reporting Center ONLY, with credit for 3 days time served. Court notes an objection to Electronic Monitoring. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant must attend at least one Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  treatment or sobriety support group per week. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including
  the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. 
  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due
  or civil judgment to be entered. 
- Obtain/Maintain Full Time employment/school or a combination of both. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated August 20, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Lorane Mantell Lee in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Julie Nitz.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for Sentencing on August 21, 2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 17.

Defendant Lorane Mantell Lee in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case adjourned.   Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, room 313 of the safety building.  Defendant ordered to appear at Justice Point immediately after court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-21-2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point violation received and filed; to be addressed on 7-23-14, 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Lorane Mantell Lee in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report addressed; defendant is not in compliance with conditions of bail.  Court grants State's motion to amend monitoring to ENHANCED SUPERVISION.
Defendant Lorane Mantell Lee in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Violation Report received and filed with court.

Defendant Lorane Mantell Lee in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-30-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lorane Mantell Lee in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case worker Julie Nitz.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for Scheduling Conference on June 3, 2014 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 26.

Defendant Lorane Mantell Lee in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in Branch 26.  Court ordered Defendant to have ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, and to follow all conditions of bail.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Lorane Mantell Lee in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Randy Sitzberger for Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO REDUCE BAIL

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Lorane Mantell Lee in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Peter M. Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
